intro: Cleistanthus longipedicellatus, commonly known as the long-stemmed cleistanthus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and compound leaves. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that are typically surrounded by bracts. It is often found in tropical rainforests and can grow up to several meters in height. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
